sourcesContent:
import Iframe from 'react-iframe' function SportelloAmico() { return (

4. Apply for Residence Permit at Sportello Amico

If you have not yet obtained an application kit from the University, get this at a Sportello Amico.
  1. Gather Documents
    Document Details
    Copy of Passport Personal details page, entry visa, entry stamp into Italy, any other page with visas and entry/exit stamps.
    Registration with National Health Service (SSN). Copy of the registration and receipts from Sportello Unico that you were told to make in the previous step.
    Codice Fiscale Provisional number will do if card hasn't been received.
    Proof of funds Use the same documents from Visa application, or bank statement will do. ¢6,542.51/year.
    Accommodation Documents Rental Contract & Dichiarazione di Ospitalità.
    Copy of enrollment certificate If not available, summary of pre-enrollment application submitted and validated through University.it (Once you get certificate, send it to Questura via PEC "Pasta Elettronica Certificata".
  2. Go to a tabaccheria and purchase ¢16 marca da bollo with cash
  3. Arrive at Sportello Amico with documents, passport and marca da bollo
  4. Settle payment slip for fee and production cost of residence permit (€30.46 + €40.00)
  5. Hand in Application and marca da bollo
  6. Fill in posta assicurata (registered letter form) and pay service charge ¢30

    Post Office Staff will verify identify with passport and you will sign this completed form in front of them.

  7. Post Office Staff will give you an appointment at Questura, at the Ufficio Immigrazione and a receipt of residence permit application
  8. Send copy of receipt to segcesena@unibo.it or segforli@unibo.it
Give (-) Gain (+)
Copy of passport pages, copy of SSN Registration, Codice fiscale, proof of funds, rental contract, enrollment certificate, marca da bollo, ¢100.46 Appointment at Questura, Residence Permit Application Receipt

if you are applying for the first issue of your residence permit and you have not yet enrolled (recommended only if you are unable to complete your enrolment quickly): the summary of your pre-enrolment application submitted and validated through the Universitaly.it portal. After completing your enrolment, remember to ask for an enrolment certificate from the relevant Student Administration office and send it via PEC “Posta Elettronica Certificata” (certified email) to the central police station (Questura). Contact the International Desk for further details on PEC (Posta Elettronica Certificata) submission. Do not submit self-certifications.

) } export default SportelloAmico
